40#include "portable.h"

42#include <limits.h>
43#include <stdio.h>
44#include <ac/stdlib.h>

46#ifdef CSRIMALLOC
47#define ber_memalloc malloc
48#define ber_memrealloc realloc
49#define ber_memfree free
50#else
51#include "lber.h"
52#endif
53
54#define AVL_INTERNAL
55#include "avl.h"
56
57/* Maximum tree depth this host's address space could support */
58#define MAX_TREE_DEPTH (sizeof(void *) * CHAR_BIT)
59
60static const int avl_bfs[] = {LH, RH};
61
62/*
63 * avl_insert -- insert a node containing data data into the avl tree
64 * with root root. fcmp is a function to call to compare the data portion
65 * of two nodes. it should take two arguments and return <, >, or == 0,
66 * depending on whether its first argument is <, >, or == its second
67 * argument (like strcmp, e.g.). fdup is a function to call when a duplicate
68 * node is inserted. it should return 0, or -1 and its return value
69 * will be the return value from avl_insert in the case of a duplicate node.
70 * the function will be called with the original node's data as its first
71 * argument and with the incoming duplicate node's data as its second
72 * argument. this could be used, for example, to keep a count with each
73 * node.
74 *
75 * NOTE: this routine may malloc memory
76 */
77int
78avl_insert( Avlnode ** root, void *data, AVL_CMP fcmp, AVL_DUP fdup )
79{
80 Avlnode *t, *p, *s, *q, *r;
81 int a, cmp, ncmp;
82
83 if ( *root == NULL ) {
84 if (( r = (Avlnode *) ber_memalloc( sizeof( Avlnode ))) == NULL ) {
85 return( -1 );
86 }
87 r->avl_link[0] = r->avl_link[1] = NULL;
88 r->avl_data = data;
89 r->avl_bf = EH;
90 *root = r;
91
92 return( 0 );
93 }
94
95 t = NULL;
96 s = p = *root;
97
98 /* find insertion point */
99 while (1) {
100 cmp = fcmp( data, p->avl_data );
101 if ( cmp == 0 )
102 return (*fdup)( p->avl_data, data );
103
104 cmp = (cmp > 0);
105 q = p->avl_link[cmp];
106 if (q == NULL) {
107 /* insert */
108 if (( q = (Avlnode *) ber_memalloc( sizeof( Avlnode ))) == NULL ) {
109 return( -1 );
110 }
111 q->avl_link[0] = q->avl_link[1] = NULL;
112 q->avl_data = data;
113 q->avl_bf = EH;
114
115 p->avl_link[cmp] = q;
116 break;
117 } else if ( q->avl_bf ) {
118 t = p;
119 s = q;
120 }
121 p = q;
122 }
123
124 /* adjust balance factors */
125 cmp = fcmp( data, s->avl_data ) > 0;
126 r = p = s->avl_link[cmp];
127 a = avl_bfs[cmp];
128
129 while ( p != q ) {
130 cmp = fcmp( data, p->avl_data ) > 0;
131 p->avl_bf = avl_bfs[cmp];
132 p = p->avl_link[cmp];
133 }
134
135 /* checks and balances */
136
137 if ( s->avl_bf == EH ) {
138 s->avl_bf = a;
139 return 0;
140 } else if ( s->avl_bf == -a ) {
141 s->avl_bf = EH;
142 return 0;
143 } else if ( s->avl_bf == a ) {
144 cmp = (a > 0);
145 ncmp = !cmp;
146 if ( r->avl_bf == a ) {
147 /* single rotation */
148 p = r;
149 s->avl_link[cmp] = r->avl_link[ncmp];
150 r->avl_link[ncmp] = s;
151 s->avl_bf = 0;
152 r->avl_bf = 0;
153 } else if ( r->avl_bf == -a ) {
154 /* double rotation */
155 p = r->avl_link[ncmp];
156 r->avl_link[ncmp] = p->avl_link[cmp];
157 p->avl_link[cmp] = r;
158 s->avl_link[cmp] = p->avl_link[ncmp];
159 p->avl_link[ncmp] = s;
160
161 if ( p->avl_bf == a ) {
162 s->avl_bf = -a;
163 r->avl_bf = 0;
164 } else if ( p->avl_bf == -a ) {
165 s->avl_bf = 0;
166 r->avl_bf = a;
167 } else {
168 s->avl_bf = 0;
169 r->avl_bf = 0;
170 }
171 p->avl_bf = 0;
172 }
173 /* Update parent */
174 if ( t == NULL )
175 *root = p;
176 else if ( s == t->avl_right )
177 t->avl_right = p;
178 else
179 t->avl_left = p;
180 }
181
182 return 0;
183}
184
185void*
186avl_delete( Avlnode **root, void* data, AVL_CMP fcmp )
187{
188 Avlnode *p, *q, *r, *top;
189 int side, side_bf, shorter, nside;
190
191 /* parent stack */
192 Avlnode *pptr[MAX_TREE_DEPTH];
193 unsigned char pdir[MAX_TREE_DEPTH];
194 int depth = 0;
195
196 if ( *root == NULL )
197 return NULL;
198
199 p = *root;
200
201 while (1) {
202 side = fcmp( data, p->avl_data );
203 if ( !side )
204 break;
205 side = ( side > 0 );
206 pdir[depth] = side;
207 pptr[depth++] = p;
208
209 p = p->avl_link[side];
210 if ( p == NULL )
211 return p;
212 }
213 data = p->avl_data;
214
215 /* If this node has two children, swap so we are deleting a node with
216 * at most one child.
217 */
218 if ( p->avl_link[0] && p->avl_link[1] ) {
219
220 /* find the immediate predecessor <q> */
221 q = p->avl_link[0];
222 side = depth;
223 pdir[depth++] = 0;
224 while (q->avl_link[1]) {
225 pdir[depth] = 1;
226 pptr[depth++] = q;
227 q = q->avl_link[1];
228 }
229 /* swap links */
230 r = p->avl_link[0];
231 p->avl_link[0] = q->avl_link[0];
232 q->avl_link[0] = r;
233
234 q->avl_link[1] = p->avl_link[1];
235 p->avl_link[1] = NULL;
236
237 q->avl_bf = p->avl_bf;
238
239 /* fix stack positions: old parent of p points to q */
240 pptr[side] = q;
241 if ( side ) {
242 r = pptr[side-1];
243 r->avl_link[pdir[side-1]] = q;
244 } else {
245 *root = q;
246 }
247 /* new parent of p points to p */
248 if ( depth-side > 1 ) {
249 r = pptr[depth-1];
250 r->avl_link[1] = p;
251 } else {
252 q->avl_link[0] = p;
253 }
254 }
255
256 /* now <p> has at most one child, get it */
257 q = p->avl_link[0] ? p->avl_link[0] : p->avl_link[1];
258
259 ber_memfree( p );
260
261 if ( !depth ) {
262 *root = q;
263 return data;
264 }
265
266 /* set the child into p's parent */
267 depth--;
268 p = pptr[depth];
269 side = pdir[depth];
270 p->avl_link[side] = q;
271
272 top = NULL;
273 shorter = 1;
274
275 while ( shorter ) {
276 p = pptr[depth];
277 side = pdir[depth];
278 nside = !side;
279 side_bf = avl_bfs[side];
280
281 /* case 1: height unchanged */
282 if ( p->avl_bf == EH ) {
283 /* Tree is now heavier on opposite side */
284 p->avl_bf = avl_bfs[nside];
285 shorter = 0;
286
287 } else if ( p->avl_bf == side_bf ) {
288 /* case 2: taller subtree shortened, height reduced */
289 p->avl_bf = EH;
290 } else {
291 /* case 3: shorter subtree shortened */
292 if ( depth )
293 top = pptr[depth-1]; /* p->parent; */
294 else
295 top = NULL;
296 /* set <q> to the taller of the two subtrees of <p> */
297 q = p->avl_link[nside];
298 if ( q->avl_bf == EH ) {
299 /* case 3a: height unchanged, single rotate */
300 p->avl_link[nside] = q->avl_link[side];
301 q->avl_link[side] = p;
302 shorter = 0;
303 q->avl_bf = side_bf;
304 p->avl_bf = (- side_bf);
305
306 } else if ( q->avl_bf == p->avl_bf ) {
307 /* case 3b: height reduced, single rotate */
308 p->avl_link[nside] = q->avl_link[side];
309 q->avl_link[side] = p;
310 shorter = 1;
311 q->avl_bf = EH;
312 p->avl_bf = EH;
313
314 } else {
315 /* case 3c: height reduced, balance factors opposite */
316 r = q->avl_link[side];
317 q->avl_link[side] = r->avl_link[nside];
318 r->avl_link[nside] = q;
319
320 p->avl_link[nside] = r->avl_link[side];
321 r->avl_link[side] = p;
322
323 if ( r->avl_bf == side_bf ) {
324 q->avl_bf = (- side_bf);
325 p->avl_bf = EH;
326 } else if ( r->avl_bf == (- side_bf)) {
327 q->avl_bf = EH;
328 p->avl_bf = side_bf;
329 } else {
330 q->avl_bf = EH;
331 p->avl_bf = EH;
332 }
333 r->avl_bf = EH;
334 q = r;
335 }
336 /* a rotation has caused <q> (or <r> in case 3c) to become
337 * the root. let <p>'s former parent know this.
338 */
339 if ( top == NULL ) {
340 *root = q;
341 } else if (top->avl_link[0] == p) {
342 top->avl_link[0] = q;
343 } else {
344 top->avl_link[1] = q;
345 }
346 /* end case 3 */
347 p = q;
348 }
349 if ( !depth )
350 break;
351 depth--;
352 } /* end while(shorter) */
353
354 return data;
355}
356
357static int
358avl_inapply( Avlnode *root, AVL_APPLY fn, void* arg, int stopflag )
359{
360 if ( root == 0 )
361 return( AVL_NOMORE );
362
363 if ( root->avl_left != 0 )
364 if ( avl_inapply( root->avl_left, fn, arg, stopflag )
365 == stopflag )
366 return( stopflag );
367
368 if ( (*fn)( root->avl_data, arg ) == stopflag )
369 return( stopflag );
370
371 if ( root->avl_right == 0 )
372 return( AVL_NOMORE );
373 else
374 return( avl_inapply( root->avl_right, fn, arg, stopflag ) );
375}
376
377static int
378avl_postapply( Avlnode *root, AVL_APPLY fn, void* arg, int stopflag )
379{
380 if ( root == 0 )
381 return( AVL_NOMORE );
382
383 if ( root->avl_left != 0 )
384 if ( avl_postapply( root->avl_left, fn, arg, stopflag )
385 == stopflag )
386 return( stopflag );
387
388 if ( root->avl_right != 0 )
389 if ( avl_postapply( root->avl_right, fn, arg, stopflag )
390 == stopflag )
391 return( stopflag );
392
393 return( (*fn)( root->avl_data, arg ) );
394}
395
396static int
397avl_preapply( Avlnode *root, AVL_APPLY fn, void* arg, int stopflag )
398{
399 if ( root == 0 )
400 return( AVL_NOMORE );
401
402 if ( (*fn)( root->avl_data, arg ) == stopflag )
403 return( stopflag );
404
405 if ( root->avl_left != 0 )
406 if ( avl_preapply( root->avl_left, fn, arg, stopflag )
407 == stopflag )
408 return( stopflag );
409
410 if ( root->avl_right == 0 )
411 return( AVL_NOMORE );
412 else
413 return( avl_preapply( root->avl_right, fn, arg, stopflag ) );
414}
415
416/*
417 * avl_apply -- avl tree root is traversed, function fn is called with
418 * arguments arg and the data portion of each node. if fn returns stopflag,
419 * the traversal is cut short, otherwise it continues. Do not use -6 as
420 * a stopflag, as this is what is used to indicate the traversal ran out
421 * of nodes.
422 */
423
424int
425avl_apply( Avlnode *root, AVL_APPLY fn, void* arg, int stopflag, int type )
426{
427 switch ( type ) {
428 case AVL_INORDER:
429 return( avl_inapply( root, fn, arg, stopflag ) );
430 case AVL_PREORDER:
431 return( avl_preapply( root, fn, arg, stopflag ) );
432 case AVL_POSTORDER:
433 return( avl_postapply( root, fn, arg, stopflag ) );
434 default:
435 fprintf( stderr, "Invalid traversal type %d\n", type );
436 return( -1 );
437 }
438
439 /* NOTREACHED */
440}
441
442/*
443 * avl_prefixapply - traverse avl tree root, applying function fprefix
444 * to any nodes that match. fcmp is called with data as its first arg
445 * and the current node's data as its second arg. it should return
446 * 0 if they match, < 0 if data is less, and > 0 if data is greater.
447 * the idea is to efficiently find all nodes that are prefixes of
448 * some key... Like avl_apply, this routine also takes a stopflag
449 * and will return prematurely if fmatch returns this value. Otherwise,
450 * AVL_NOMORE is returned.
451 */
452
453int
454avl_prefixapply(
455 Avlnode *root,
456 void* data,
457 AVL_CMP fmatch,
458 void* marg,
459 AVL_CMP fcmp,
460 void* carg,
461 int stopflag
462)
463{
464 int cmp;
465
466 if ( root == 0 )
467 return( AVL_NOMORE );
468
469 cmp = (*fcmp)( data, root->avl_data /* , carg */);
470 if ( cmp == 0 ) {
471 if ( (*fmatch)( root->avl_data, marg ) == stopflag )
472 return( stopflag );
473
474 if ( root->avl_left != 0 )
475 if ( avl_prefixapply( root->avl_left, data, fmatch,
476 marg, fcmp, carg, stopflag ) == stopflag )
477 return( stopflag );
478
479 if ( root->avl_right != 0 )
480 return( avl_prefixapply( root->avl_right, data, fmatch,
481 marg, fcmp, carg, stopflag ) );
482 else
483 return( AVL_NOMORE );
484
485 } else if ( cmp < 0 ) {
486 if ( root->avl_left != 0 )
487 return( avl_prefixapply( root->avl_left, data, fmatch,
488 marg, fcmp, carg, stopflag ) );
489 } else {
490 if ( root->avl_right != 0 )
491 return( avl_prefixapply( root->avl_right, data, fmatch,
492 marg, fcmp, carg, stopflag ) );
493 }
494
495 return( AVL_NOMORE );
496}
497
498/*
499 * avl_free -- traverse avltree root, freeing the memory it is using.
500 * the dfree() is called to free the data portion of each node. The
501 * number of items actually freed is returned.
502 */
503
504int
505avl_free( Avlnode *root, AVL_FREE dfree )
506{
507 int nleft, nright;
508
509 if ( root == 0 )
510 return( 0 );
511
512 nleft = nright = 0;
513 if ( root->avl_left != 0 )
514 nleft = avl_free( root->avl_left, dfree );
515
516 if ( root->avl_right != 0 )
517 nright = avl_free( root->avl_right, dfree );
518
519 if ( dfree )
520 (*dfree)( root->avl_data );
521 ber_memfree( root );
522
523 return( nleft + nright + 1 );
524}
525
526/*
527 * avl_find -- search avltree root for a node with data data. the function
528 * cmp is used to compare things. it is called with data as its first arg
529 * and the current node data as its second. it should return 0 if they match,
530 * < 0 if arg1 is less than arg2 and > 0 if arg1 is greater than arg2.
531 */
532
533Avlnode *
534avl_find2( Avlnode *root, const void *data, AVL_CMP fcmp )
535{
536 int cmp;
537
538 while ( root != 0 && (cmp = (*fcmp)( data, root->avl_data )) != 0 ) {
539 cmp = cmp > 0;
540 root = root->avl_link[cmp];
541 }
542 return root;
543}
544
545void*
546avl_find( Avlnode *root, const void* data, AVL_CMP fcmp )
547{
548 int cmp;
549
550 while ( root != 0 && (cmp = (*fcmp)( data, root->avl_data )) != 0 ) {
551 cmp = cmp > 0;
552 root = root->avl_link[cmp];
553 }
554
555 return( root ? root->avl_data : 0 );
556}
557
558/*
559 * avl_find_lin -- search avltree root linearly for a node with data data.
560 * the function cmp is used to compare things. it is called with data as its
561 * first arg and the current node data as its second. it should return 0 if
562 * they match, non-zero otherwise.
563 */
564
565void*
566avl_find_lin( Avlnode *root, const void* data, AVL_CMP fcmp )
567{
568 void* res;
569
570 if ( root == 0 )
571 return( NULL );
572
573 if ( (*fcmp)( data, root->avl_data ) == 0 )
574 return( root->avl_data );
575
576 if ( root->avl_left != 0 )
577 if ( (res = avl_find_lin( root->avl_left, data, fcmp ))
578 != NULL )
579 return( res );
580
581 if ( root->avl_right == 0 )
582 return( NULL );
583 else
584 return( avl_find_lin( root->avl_right, data, fcmp ) );
585}
586
587/* NON-REENTRANT INTERFACE */
588
589static void* *avl_list;
590static int avl_maxlist;
591static int avl_nextlist;
592
593#define AVL_GRABSIZE 100
594
595/* ARGSUSED */
596static int
597avl_buildlist( void* data, void* arg )
598{
599 static int slots;
600
601 if ( avl_list == (void* *) 0 ) {
602 avl_list = (void* *) ber_memalloc(AVL_GRABSIZE * sizeof(void*));
603 slots = AVL_GRABSIZE;
604 avl_maxlist = 0;
605 } else if ( avl_maxlist == slots ) {
606 slots += AVL_GRABSIZE;
607 avl_list = (void* *) ber_memrealloc( (char *) avl_list,
608 (unsigned) slots * sizeof(void*));
609 }
610
611 avl_list[ avl_maxlist++ ] = data;
612
613 return( 0 );
614}
615
616/*
617 * avl_getfirst() and avl_getnext() are provided as alternate tree
618 * traversal methods, to be used when a single function cannot be
619 * provided to be called with every node in the tree. avl_getfirst()
620 * traverses the tree and builds a linear list of all the nodes,
621 * returning the first node. avl_getnext() returns the next thing
622 * on the list built by avl_getfirst(). This means that avl_getfirst()
623 * can take a while, and that the tree should not be messed with while
624 * being traversed in this way, and that multiple traversals (even of
625 * different trees) cannot be active at once.
626 */
627
628void*
629avl_getfirst( Avlnode *root )
630{
631 if ( avl_list ) {
632 ber_memfree( (char *) avl_list);
633 avl_list = (void* *) 0;
634 }
635 avl_maxlist = 0;
636 avl_nextlist = 0;
637
638 if ( root == 0 )
639 return( 0 );
640
641 (void) avl_apply( root, avl_buildlist, (void*) 0, -1, AVL_INORDER );
642
643 return( avl_list[ avl_nextlist++ ] );
644}
645
646void*
647avl_getnext( void )
648{
649 if ( avl_list == 0 )
650 return( 0 );
651
652 if ( avl_nextlist == avl_maxlist ) {
653 ber_memfree( (void*) avl_list);
654 avl_list = (void* *) 0;
655 return( 0 );
656 }
657
658 return( avl_list[ avl_nextlist++ ] );
659}
660
661/* end non-reentrant code */
662
663
664int
665avl_dup_error( void* left, void* right )
666{
667 return( -1 );
668}
669
670int
671avl_dup_ok( void* left, void* right )
672{
673 return( 0 );
674}
